thread.title: The Bachelor Australia: Sam Wood on rejecting Heather Maltman
thread.title_full: The Bachelor Australia: Sam Wood on rejecting Heather Maltman | DailyTelegraph

author: Tiffany Dunk
title: The Bachelor Australia: Sam Wood on rejecting Heather Maltman
text:
AFTER breaking Heather Maltman’s heart on live TV last night, Bachelor Sam Wood has gone from hero to zero.
Currently being dubbed Australia’s most hated man , Wood admitted that the tag stings but is adamant that he wouldn’t change the controversial decision he made to send Maltman home.
Heartbroken ... Heather was devastated not to receive a rose from Bachelor Sam Wood. “I don’t feel like I’ve done anything wrong,” he told News Corp Australia.
Other Stories Inside the mind of a 9/11 truther World From athlete to high class escort Sport Ministers in damage control over Cabinet ‘dead wood’ purge Nsw 0 comments Fed’s ‘disrespectful’ new tactic Tennis Matty Johns’ NRL Finals predictions Nrl 0 comments 30 photos we should never forget World “I followed my heart the whole way through and the decisions I’ve made were absolutely the right decisions. My decision (to send Maltman home) was one of those occasions where it was really a no win for anyone, but it had to be done.”
Friend zone ... Despite having an initial multitude of sparks, Wood says he realised he’d never be more than “just friends” with Maltman. Despite this, he said that watching the events unfold once more on TV was “horrible”.
“It was hard at the time, then reliving it last night was just horrible,” said Wood.
“I understand that so many people have fallen in love with Heather because she’s such an incredible girl, so it wasn’t a terribly popular decision.”
Having not spoken to Maltman since he said goodbye to her at the mansion, Wood said he is keen to now check in and see how she is faring post-heartbreak. However he added that he will have to run it past the woman he chooses on the show first.
The right choice ... Sam Wood says that he is in love with the girl he chooses in Thursday night’s finale. “I would obviously never do anything to jeopardise my relationship, but if all of us were friends and it was all amicable then I would love to sit down with Heather and make sure she’s okay and see what she’s up to now,” he said.
LISTEN TO OUR VERDICT ON LAST NIGHT’S SHOW
